properties.comment: Linked data queries for global queries
properties.entry: n2000habitats n2000birds n2000other estatcodes euringcodes habides art17delv2012s annex2 annex4 annex5 gisd
Natura 2000 codelist of Annex I habitats (SDF field: 3.1)
Codelist for habitat types under Directive 2009/147/EC.
SELECT CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/habitats/',ID_HABITAT) AS FACTSHEET, CODE_2000, IF(PRIORITY=1,'*',NULL) AS PRIORITY, SCIENTIFIC_NAME FROM chm62edt_habitat WHERE CODE_2000 IS NOT NULL ORDER BY CODE_2000
Natura 2000 codelist for bird species (SDF fields 3.2, 3.3)

Codelist for bird species under Directive 2009/147/EC. In connection with the work on the checklist for reporting under Article 12 of the Birds Directive, the coding for Bird species has been extended. The Habitats Committee has been informed on the extended list (Meeting 25. Sept. 2011). This extended codelist is also available as reference table in the Natura 2000 database.

SELECT a.OBJECT AS N2000CODE, SCIENTIFIC_NAME, AUTHOR, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/',ID_SPECIES) AS FACTSHEET, c.OBJECT AS COMMENT FROM chm62edt_species AS s JOIN chm62edt_nature_object_attributes AS a ON s.ID_NATURE_OBJECT=a.ID_NATURE_OBJECT AND a.NAME="sameSynonymN2000" LEFT JOIN chm62edt_nature_object_attributes AS c ON s.ID_NATURE_OBJECT=c.ID_NATURE_OBJECT AND c.NAME="_n2000CodeComment" WHERE ID_GROUP_SPECIES=5 ORDER BY a.OBJECT
Natura 2000 codelist for species (Annex II,IV,V) (SDF fields 3.2, 3.3)

In connection with the work on the checklist for reporting under Article 17 Habitats Directive, the coding for species has been extended. The Habitats Committee has been informed on the extended list (Meeting 26. April 2012). This codelist is also available as reference table in the Natura 2000 database.

SELECT a.OBJECT AS N2000CODE, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, s.AUTHOR, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/',s.ID_SPECIES) AS FACTSHEET, c.OBJECT AS COMMENT, IF(s.ID_SPECIES != s.ID_SPECIES_LINK, v.SCIENTIFIC_NAME,NULL) AS VALID_NAME, IF(s.ID_SPECIES != s.ID_SPECIES_LINK, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/',v.ID_SPECIES),NULL) AS VALIDLINK FROM chm62edt_species AS s JOIN chm62edt_nature_object_attributes AS a ON s.ID_NATURE_OBJECT=a.ID_NATURE_OBJECT AND a.NAME="sameSynonymN2000" LEFT JOIN chm62edt_nature_object_attributes AS c ON s.ID_NATURE_OBJECT=c.ID_NATURE_OBJECT AND c.NAME="_n2000CodeComment" JOIN chm62edt_species AS v ON s.ID_SPECIES_LINK = v.ID_SPECIES WHERE s.ID_GROUP_SPECIES<>5 ORDER BY a.OBJECT
This is a list of NUTS codes queried as external data from EEA's Semantic Data Service.
Eurostat fishes code list with EUNIS species matches

The Eurostat code list is primarily used for fishery statistics. The 3-alpha identifier is a unique code made of three letters that is widely used for the exchange of data with national correspondents and among fishery agencies.
EURING species that are known in EUNIS

This is a list of EURING codes for the species that are known in EUNIS - It is not a complete EURING list. To get the EURING code list visit http://blx1.bto.org/euringcodes/species.jsp or the Euring home page.

SELECT OBJECT AS code, SCIENTIFIC_NAME, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', ID_SPECIES) AS URL FROM chm62edt_nature_object_attributes JOIN chm62edt_species USING(ID_NATURE_OBJECT) WHERE NAME="sameSynonymEURING" ORDER BY OBJECT
Species with Habitats or Birds directive derogations
Any species mentioned on a derogation form
Species with 2013 deliveries on Habitats directive Art. 17

Assessments on the conservation status of the habitat types and species of Community interest have been carried out in EU 27 for the period 2007-2012, compiled as part of the Habitats Directive - Article 17 reporting process. The table lists the species for which there were reports made.
Annex II: animal and plant species of community interest whose conservation requires the designation of special areas of conservation.

SELECT g.COMMON_NAME AS SPECIES_GROUP, t.NAME AS FAMILY, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', s.ID_SPECIES) AS URL, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, IF(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK != s.ID_SPECIES, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', s.ID_SPECIES_LINK), NULL ) AS VALID_URL, IF(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK != s.ID_SPECIES, p.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, NULL) AS VALID_NAME FROM chm62edt_reports AS r JOIN chm62edt_report_type USING (ID_REPORT_TYPE) JOIN chm62edt_species AS s USING (ID_NATURE_OBJECT) JOIN chm62edt_group_species AS g USING(ID_GROUP_SPECIES) JOIN chm62edt_species AS p ON s.ID_SPECIES_LINK=p.ID_SPECIES LEFT JOIN chm62edt_taxonomy AS t ON s.ID_TAXONOMY=t.ID_TAXONOMY AND t.LEVEL='Family' WHERE LOOKUP_TYPE='LEGAL_STATUS' AND r.ID_DC IN (1554, 1823, 2325) ORDER BY SPECIES_GROUP, FAMILY, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME
Annex IV: animal and plant species of community interest in need of strict protection.

SELECT g.COMMON_NAME AS SPECIES_GROUP, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', s.ID_SPECIES) AS URL, t.NAME AS FAMILY, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, IF(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK != s.ID_SPECIES, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', s.ID_SPECIES_LINK), NULL ) AS VALID_URL, IF(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK != s.ID_SPECIES, p.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, NULL) AS VALID_NAME FROM chm62edt_reports AS r JOIN chm62edt_report_type USING (ID_REPORT_TYPE) JOIN chm62edt_species AS s USING (ID_NATURE_OBJECT) JOIN chm62edt_group_species AS g USING(ID_GROUP_SPECIES) JOIN chm62edt_species AS p ON s.ID_SPECIES_LINK=p.ID_SPECIES LEFT JOIN chm62edt_taxonomy AS t ON s.ID_TAXONOMY=t.ID_TAXONOMY AND t.LEVEL='Family' WHERE LOOKUP_TYPE='LEGAL_STATUS' AND r.ID_DC IN (1555, 1824, 2326) ORDER BY SPECIES_GROUP, FAMILY, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME
Annex V: animal and plant species of community interest whose taking in the wild and exploitation may be subject to management measures.

SELECT g.COMMON_NAME AS SPECIES_GROUP, t.NAME AS FAMILY, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', s.ID_SPECIES) AS URL, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, IF(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK != s.ID_SPECIES, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', s.ID_SPECIES_LINK), NULL ) AS VALID_URL, IF(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK != s.ID_SPECIES, p.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, NULL) AS VALID_NAME FROM chm62edt_reports AS r JOIN chm62edt_report_type USING (ID_REPORT_TYPE) JOIN chm62edt_species AS s USING (ID_NATURE_OBJECT) JOIN chm62edt_group_species AS g USING(ID_GROUP_SPECIES) JOIN chm62edt_species AS p ON s.ID_SPECIES_LINK=p.ID_SPECIES LEFT JOIN chm62edt_taxonomy AS t ON s.ID_TAXONOMY=t.ID_TAXONOMY AND t.LEVEL='Family' WHERE LOOKUP_TYPE='LEGAL_STATUS' AND r.ID_DC IN (1556, 1825, 2327) ORDER BY SPECIES_GROUP, FAMILY, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME
Invasive species according to the Global Invasive Species Database
Some of the species in EUNIS are registered as invasive in the Global Invasive Species Database (GISD). This is a list of them. Note that EUNIS does not have information on all the invasive species.

SELECT g.COMMON_NAME AS SPECIES_GROUP, t.NAME AS FAMILY, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', s.ID_SPECIES) AS URL, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME FROM chm62edt_nature_object_attributes AS a JOIN chm62edt_species AS s USING(ID_NATURE_OBJECT) JOIN chm62edt_group_species AS g USING(ID_GROUP_SPECIES) LEFT JOIN chm62edt_taxonomy AS t ON s.ID_TAXONOMY=t.ID_TAXONOMY AND t.LEVEL='Family' WHERE a.NAME="sameSynonymISSG" ORDER BY SPECIES_GROUP, FAMILY, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME
